artworkTitle: Prehistoric Art depicted in Pop Art Style

keySubjects: Cave walls or rocky landscape elements (as subject matter)
conceptDefinition.narrativeFocus: Depict a group of simplified, active human figures engaged in hunting a large bison or similar prehistoric animal. Focus on the action and relationship between hunters and prey.
conceptDefinition.desiredEmotion: A mix of ritualistic reverence, primal tension, and the importance of the hunt for survival.
symbolismHints: Emphasize the size and power of the animal
Use repetitive patterns if suggesting ritual
references: Altamira cave art depictions of bison

styleDefinition.origin: Pop Art (Britain and USA, emerging mid-1950s, flourishing 1960s AD)
visualCharacteristics: Incorporation of imagery from popular culture, mass media, advertising, comic books, and consumer goods
Use of recognizable, everyday subjects and celebrity icons
Often features bold outlines, flat areas of color, and hard edges
Impersonal, mechanical, or mass-produced aesthetic, often minimizing the artist's 'hand'
May employ irony, humor, or critique (or celebration) of consumer culture
Repetition, serial imagery, and grid formats are common
Blurring of boundaries between fine art and popular culture
techniques: Simulation of commercial printing techniques like Ben-Day dots (Lichtenstein)
Use of flat, opaque acrylic paints
Emphasis on clean lines and flat application
styleDefinition.mediumSimulation: Acrylic painting on canvas or Silkscreen print simulation

colorPalette.description: Typically utilizes bright, bold, high-key colors drawn from commercial printing, advertising, and comics. Features flat, unmodulated color areas and strong contrasts. Often employs primary colors prominently.

styleDefinition.textureEmphasis: Generally emphasizes flat, smooth, untextured surfaces that mimic the look of commercial printing or mass-produced items. Visible brushstrokes or impasto are typically avoided to achieve a mechanical, impersonal finish.
styleDefinition.compositionStyle: Often bold, simple, and direct, resembling advertisements, product packaging, or comic book panels. May use repetition, grids, or serial formats. Clear outlines and flat shapes define the composition. Often features a centralized, iconic subject.
references: Richard Hamilton ('Just what is it that makes today's homes so different, so appealing?')

sceneContext.lightingStyle: Flat, even, bright lighting with no discernible source or shadows, typical of Egyptian art.
sceneContext.cameraView: Strict profile or composite view, straight-on perspective, avoiding complex angles.
sceneContext.settingSuggestion: A stylized representation of a cave interior or outdoor landscape, framed perhaps with simple geometric Egyptian borders or patterns.

avoid: Dynamic, fluid poses (use stiff Egyptian poses)
